intro: Ascyrum coriaceum, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically covered in a waxy, rough texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in a structure called a cyathium, which is typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Ascyrum coriaceum is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is commonly found in rocky or sandy habitats.
